results.adx_keywords: Television;Mergers, Acquisitions and Divestitures;Video Recordings, Downloads and Streaming;Television Sets and Media Devices;Cable Television;Dolan, James L;AMC (TV Network)
results.title: Want to Understand Television’s Troubles? Look at AMC.
results.abstract: The company has struggled to earn enough from streaming to make up for losses from its traditional cable business. It is a story widespread in the industry.

media.caption: Sam Reid as Lestat de Lioncourt in the AMC Networks series “Interview With the Vampire.” The show is one of the most popular programs in the United States.

results.adx_keywords: Television;News and News Media;Deaths (Obituaries);Peabody Awards;Veterans;Drew Griffin;CNN;Veterans Affairs Department;Atlanta (Ga)
results.title: Drew Griffin, CNN Investigative Journalist, Dies at 60
results.abstract: His reporting on delayed care for military veterans at Veterans Affairs hospitals led to the resignation of the secretary of the department.

media.caption: Drew Griffin in 2015. He led an investigative team that broke a story about at least 19 veterans who died after their appointments at Veterans Affairs hospitals had been delayed.

results.adx_keywords: Robberies and Thefts;De Niro, Robert;Police Department (NYC)
results.byline: By Hurubie Meko and Chelsia Rose Marcius
results.title: Robert De Niro Is Victim of Attempted Burglary in Manhattan
results.abstract: A woman broke into the actor’s rental on the Upper East Side in the early hours of Monday, police said. Officers saw her going in through a basement door, they said.

media.caption: A publicist for Robert De Niro confirmed the break-in, but declined to comment further.

results.adx_keywords: Social Media;Mergers, Acquisitions and Divestitures;Polls and Public Opinion;Censorship;Musk, Elon;Twitter
results.byline: By Kate Conger and Ryan Mac
results.title: ‘The Last Straw’: Twitter Users Rage Over Elon Musk’s Latest Actions
results.abstract: Fury mounted over Mr. Musk’s moves to prevent Twitter users from sharing links to other social media platforms. The billionaire also asked whether he should remain as head of the service.

media.caption: Elon Musk, center, was photographed with Jared Kushner, left, at the World Cup final in Qatar on Sunday. Later that day, Mr. Musk asked his Twitter followers to decide whether he should remain as head of the social media service.

results.adx_keywords: Soccer;World Cup 2022 (Soccer);audio-neutral-informative;Messi, Lionel;Qatar
results.byline: By Sabrina Tavernise, Rob Szypko, Asthaa Chaturvedi, Carlos Prieto, Marc Georges, Dan Powell, Marion Lozano and Chris Wood
results.title: How This World Cup Changed Soccer
results.abstract: The 2022 tournament in Qatar may be an unsettling sign of things to come in the professional sport.

results.adx_keywords: Christmas;Christians and Christianity;Protestant Churches;United States
results.title: O Come All Ye Faithful, Except When Christmas Falls on a Sunday
results.abstract: Worried about coaxing people into pews when they’d rather be in their pajamas, some Protestant pastors are canceling Sunday services on Dec. 25.

media.caption: For some churches, following a Christmas Eve service with a Christmas morning service did not seem practical.
media.copyright: Joanna Kulesza for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Christmas;Weather;Cold and Cold Spells;Snow and Snowstorms;United States;Appalachian Region;East Coast (US);Northeastern States (US);Rocky Mountains
results.title: Winter Storm and Bitter Cold Could Disrupt Holiday Travel
results.abstract: A storm could make for treacherous conditions for parts of the country leading up to Christmas. Temperatures are also expected to plummet, forecasters said.

media.caption: Cities on the East Coast, including New York City, are unlikely to have a white Christmas, as the storm will probably pass on Thursday and Friday as a “rain event” before temperatures plummet.

results.adx_keywords: United States Politics and Government;Ethics and Official Misconduct;Elections, House of Representatives;Campaign Finance;Santos, George (1988- );Devolder Organization;House of Representatives;House Committee on Ethics;Republican Party;New York State;Nassau County (NY)
results.byline: By Michael Gold and Grace Ashford
results.title: George Santos Dodges Questions as Democrats Label Him ‘Unfit to Serve’
results.abstract: Democratic House leaders stopped short of calling for the resignation of Mr. Santos, a Republican, who may have misrepresented himself in his résumé.

media.caption: Representative-elect George Santos continued Monday to duck questions about his background, except to release a brief statement from his lawyer.

results.adx_keywords: Airlines and Airplanes;Aviation Accidents, Safety and Disasters;Hawaiian Airlines Incorporated;Hawaii
results.title: 36 People Hurt, 11 Seriously, as Turbulence Rocks a Flight to Hawaii
results.abstract: A 14-month-old and a teenager were among those injured in the flight from Phoenix to Honolulu, the authorities said.

media.caption: Some of those who injured when a Hawaiian Airlines flight experienced turbulence on Sunday were taken to The Queen’s Medical Center in Honolulu.

results.adx_keywords: Midterm Elections (2022);United States Politics and Government;Elections, House of Representatives;Campaign Finance;Content Type: Personal Profile;Ethics and Official Misconduct;internal-sub-only;Santos, George (1988- );House of Representatives;Baruch College;Citigroup Inc;Goldman Sachs Group Inc;Devolder Organization;Friends of Pets United;New York State;Long Island (NY)
results.byline: By Grace Ashford and Michael Gold
results.title: Who Is Rep.-Elect George Santos? His Résumé May Be Largely Fiction.
results.abstract: Mr. Santos, a Republican from New York, says he’s the “embodiment of the American dream.” But he seems to have misrepresented a number of his career highlights.

media.caption: George Santos, at the Republican Jewish Coalition in November, said he worked at Citigroup and Goldman Sachs, but neither firm had records of his employment.
media.copyright: Mikayla Whitmore for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: United States Politics and Government;Storming of the US Capitol (Jan, 2021);Trump, Donald J;Ornato, Anthony M;House Select Committee to Investigate the January 6th Attack
results.title: How to Watch the Jan. 6 Committee’s Final Session
results.abstract: The House committee will meet on Monday afternoon to consider criminal referrals against former President Donald J. Trump and several of his associates before issuing its final report.
org_facet: House Select Committee to Investigate the January 6th Attack

media.caption: The House Jan. 6 committee during a hearing in June.

results.adx_keywords: United States Politics and Government;Roberts, John G Jr;Kagan, Elena;Supreme Court (US)
results.title: An ‘Imperial Supreme Court’ Asserts Its Power, Alarming Scholars
results.abstract: Several new studies document the current court’s distinctive insistence on its dominance and the justices’ willingness to use procedural shortcuts to achieve it.

media.caption: One study found that the Supreme Court led since 2005 by Chief Justice John G. Roberts Jr. has been “uniquely willing to check executive authority.”

results.adx_keywords: Television;Web-Original Programming;Layoffs and Job Reductions;Video Recordings, Downloads and Streaming;Writing and Writers;Amazon.com Inc;Apple TV;HBO Max;Netflix Inc;Paramount Plus;Walt Disney Company;Warner Bros Discovery
results.title: Streaming’s Golden Age Is Suddenly Dimming
results.abstract: After years of breakneck growth, the number of scripted TV series orders made by networks and streamers is in decline.

media.caption: The never-ending supply of new programming that helped define the streaming era — spawning shows at a breakneck pace but also overwhelming viewers with too many choices — appears to finally be slowing.

results.adx_keywords: vis-photo;Abortion;Roe v Wade (Supreme Court Decision);Dobbs v Jackson Women's Health Organization (Supreme Court Decision);Blue Haven Ranch (Nonprofit);Texas
results.byline: By Elizabeth Williamson and Erin Schaff
results.title: ‘I’m Not Ready’: A Mother Denied an Abortion in Texas Faces an Uncertain Future
results.abstract: Faith-based Blue Haven Ranch provides temporary aid for poor Texas women with newborns. But how will they survive when it ends?
des_facet: Dobbs v Jackson Women's Health Organization (Supreme Court Decision)

media.caption: Tamara Nelson soothing her son Cason with her daughter, Harmony, nearby. Cason was born in June, after Ms. Nelson fled domestic violence and was denied an abortion last year.

results.adx_keywords: Plastic Surgery;Social Media;Surgery and Surgeons;American Society of Plastic Surgeons;TikTok (ByteDance)
results.title: Why Is Everyone Suddenly Obsessed With Buccal Fat?
results.abstract: What even is buccal fat?

media.caption: Dr. Andrew Jacono, a plastic surgeon, pointed to the faces of two cherubs, the round-faced angels on the bottom of the painting “Sistine Madonna” by the Italian artist Raphael, as examples of prime candidates for buccal fat removal.
media.copyright: DEA/E. Lessing/De Agostini, via Getty Images

results.title: When Harry Met Meghan
results.abstract: Harry and Meghan seemed content to be part of the royal family if only the royal family had been willing to embrace change.
per_facet: Charles III, King of the United Kingdom

results.adx_keywords: Soccer;World Cup (Soccer);Witchcraft;Superstitions;vis-photo;Messi, Lionel;Argentina;Rosario (Argentina)
results.byline: By Jack Nicas and Ana Lankes
results.title: Behind Argentina’s World Cup Magic, an Army of Witches
results.abstract: France might have its star Kylian Mbappé, but Argentina has hundreds of “brujas” casting spells to protect Lionel Messi and the rest of its national squad.

media.caption: Magalí Martínez, a self-proclaimed witch, is one of hundreds who has used magic to try to help Argentina’s soccer team.
media.copyright: Anita Pouchard Serra for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Murders, Attempted Murders and Homicides;Mass Shootings;Canada;Ontario (Canada)
results.byline: By Vjosa Isai and Norimitsu Onishi
results.title: 5 Killed in Shooting at Canadian Condo Building, Police Say
results.abstract: The 73-year-old gunman, who was fatally shot by the police at a high-rise building in Vaughan, Ontario, had been in a long-running feud with the condo board.

media.caption: The police at the scene of the mass shooting in Vaughan, Ontario, on Monday.
media.copyright: Ian Willms for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: News and News Media;Visas;Immigration and Emigration;O'Brien, Phil (Journalist);Citizenship and Immigration Services (US);Hell's Kitchen (Manhattan, NY);United States
results.title: Another Sign of Hard Times in Local News: A Declined Visa
results.abstract: Phil O’Brien, a Briton who has run a Manhattan publication for several years, had his visa denied because immigration officials deemed his struggling business “marginal.”

media.caption: Phil O’Brien, publisher of W42ST, a Hell’s Kitchen local news site, was denied a visa renewal to the United States.
media.copyright: Suzie Howell for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Photography;Russian Invasion of Ukraine (2022);Content Type: Personal Profile;Maier, Vivian;Zaharia Cusnir;Moldova;Romania;Russia
results.title: How a Chance Discovery of Old Negatives Revealed a Master Photographer
results.abstract: For Zaharia Cusnir, photography was an all-consuming passion. Now, nearly 30 years after he died in obscurity, the Moldovan’s fame is rising.

media.caption: Photographs by Zaharia Cusnir outside his old home in Rosietici, Moldova. He depicted people as they wanted to be seen, as individuals brimming with character.
media.copyright: Andreea Campeanu for The New York Times
